nodes.documentation:
@title Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs) on Ethereum ETH.
 * This contract provides a way to create and keep HTLCs for ETH.
 * See HashedTimelockERC20.sol for a contract that provides the same functions
for ERC20 tokens.
 * Protocol:
 *  1) newContract(receiver, sk1, sk1y, timelock) - a sender calls this to create
     a new HTLC and gets back a 32 byte contract id
 2) withdraw(contractId, sk2) - once the receiver knows sk2 
     they can claim the ETH with this function
 3) refund() - after timelock has expired and if the receiver did not
     withdraw funds the sender / creator of the HTLC can get their ETH
     back with this function.
nodes.name: FairTradeExtImproved

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "timelock time must be in the future"

withdraw

getContract

attributes.documentation:
@dev Is there a contract with id _contractId.
@param _contractId Id into contracts mapping.
attributes.name: haveContract

params._contractId: HTLC contract id return All parameters in struct LockContract for _contractId HTLC

newContract(address,bytes32,uint256,uint.details: Sender sets up a new hash time lock contract depositing the ETH and providing the reciever lock terms.

params._sk1x: , _sk1y The calculated results based on sk1 which was given during the negotiation phase.
params._timelock: UNIX epoch seconds time that the lock expires at.                 Refunds can be made after this time.

newContract(address,bytes32,uint256,uint.return: contractId Id of the new HTLC. This is needed for subsequent                   calls.

refund(bytes32).details: Called by the sender if there was no withdraw AND the time lock has expired. This will refund the contract amount.

params._contractId: Id of HTLC to refund from.

withdraw(bytes32,uint256).details: Called by the receiver once they know sk2. This will transfer the locked funds to their address.

devdoc.title: Hashed Timelock Contracts (HTLCs) on Ethereum ETH. * This contract provides a way to create and keep HTLCs for ETH. * See HashedTimelockERC20.sol for a contract that provides the same functions for ERC20 tokens. * Protocol: *  1) newContract(receiver, sk1, sk1y, timelock) - a sender calls this to create     a new HTLC and gets back a 32 byte contract id 2) withdraw(contractId, sk2) - once the receiver knows sk2      they can claim the ETH with this function 3) refund() - after timelock has expired and if the receiver did not     withdraw funds the sender / creator of the HTLC can get their ETH     back with this function.
